db:abstract.db:para: The QPlace class represents a set of data about a place.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.6.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A place is a point of interest, it could be a favorite restaurant, a park or someone's home. A QPlace object represents a place by acting as a container for various information about that place.
This information can be divided into 2 broad classifications

The place details consist of properties of the place, such as the name, location, contact information and so on. When a place is returned during a search, these details are filled in. Sometimes in order to save bandwidth, there are further details about the place that can be retrieved on an individual place by place basis, if the user is interested. The QPlace::detailsFetched() function can be queried to see if all available details have been fetched, and if not, QPlaceManager::getPlaceDetails() can be used to retrieve them. Precisely which details are populated during a search and which need to be fetched individually may vary from provider to provider. See plugin documentation for more details.

The rich content of a place consists of items such as images, reviews and editorials. Potentially there may be many rich content items, so they are treated separately from the place details. They can be retrieved in a paged fashion via QPlaceManager::getPlaceContent(). If necessary, the content may be assigned to a place so it can act as a convenient container.

db:section.db:title: Contact Information
db:section.db:para: The contact information of a place is based around a common set of contact types. To retrieve all the phone numbers of a place, one would do:
The contact types are string values by design to allow for providers to introduce new contact types.
For convenience there are a set of functions which return the value of the first contact detail of each type.

db:section.db:title: Extended Attributes
db:section.db:para: Places may have additional attributes which are not covered in the formal API. Similar to contacts attributes are based around a common set of attribute types. To retrieve an extended attribute one would do:
The attribute types are string values by design to allow providers to introduce new attribute types.

db:section.db:title: Content
db:section.db:para: The QPlace object is only meant to be a convenient container to hold rich content such as images, reviews and so on. Retrieval of content should happen via QPlaceManager::getPlaceContent().

The content is stored as a QPlaceContent::Collection which contains both the index of the content, as well as the content itself. This enables developers to check whether a particular item has already been retrieved and if not, then request that content.

db:section.db:title: Attribution
db:section.db:para: Places have a field for a rich text attribution string. Some providers may require that the attribution be shown when a place is displayed to a user.

db:section.db:title: Categories
db:section.db:para: Different categories may be assigned to a place to indicate that the place is associated with those categories. When saving a place, the only meaningful data is the category id, the rest of the category data is effectively ignored. The category must already exist before saving the place (it is not possible to create a new category, assign it to the place, save the place and expect the category to be created).

db:section.db:title: Saving Caveats
db:section.db:para: The Places API is currently designed for only saving core details. Saving rich content like images and reviews or details like supplier and rating is not a supported use case. Typically a manager will generally ignore these fields upon save and may produce a warning message if they are populated.
The Places API only supports saving of the following core details:

db:listitem.db:para: categories (tag-like names to describe a place)

db:section.db:para: It is possible that providers may only support a subset of these. See the plugin documentation for more details.
Saving of properties such as the rating, extended attributes, images, reviews, editorials and supplier is explicitly not supported by the Places API.

db:section.db:title: QPlace::QPlace()
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty place object.

db:section.db:title: QPlace::QPlace(const QPlace &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QPlace::~QPlace()
db:section.db:para: Destroys this place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::appendContactDetail(const QString &contactType, const QPlaceContactDetail &detail)
db:section.db:para: Appends a contact detail of a specified contactType.
See QPlaceContactDetail for a list of common contact types.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::attribution() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a rich text attribution string of the place. Note, some providers may have a requirement where the attribution must be shown whenever a place is displayed to an end user.

db:section.db:title: QList<QPlaceCategory> QPlace::categories() const
db:section.db:para: Returns categories that this place belongs to.

db:section.db:title: QList<QPlaceContactDetail> QPlace::contactDetails(const QString &contactType) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a list of contact details of the specified contactType.
See QPlaceContactDetail for a list of common contact types.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QPlace::contactTypes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of contact details this place has.
See QPlaceContactDetail for a list of common contact types.

db:section.db:title: QPlaceContent::Collection QPlace::content(QPlaceContent::Type type) const
db:section.db:para: Returns a collection of content associated with a place. This collection is a map with the key being the index of the content object and value being the content object itself.
The type specifies which kind of content is to be retrieved.

db:section.db:title: bool QPlace::detailsFetched() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the details of this place have been fetched, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QPlaceAttribute QPlace::extendedAttribute(const QString &attributeType) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the exteded attribute corresponding to the specified attributeType. If the place does not have that particular attribute type, a default constructed QPlaceExtendedAttribute is returned.

db:section.db:title: QStringList QPlace::extendedAttributeTypes() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the types of extended attributes that this place has.

db:section.db:title: QPlaceIcon QPlace::icon() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the icon of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::insertContent(QPlaceContent::Type type, const QPlaceContent::Collection &content)
db:section.db:para: Adds a collection of content of the given type to the place. Any index in content that already exists is overwritten.

db:section.db:title: bool QPlace::isEmpty() const
db:section.db:para: Returns a boolean indicating whether the all the fields of the place are empty or not.

db:section.db:title: QGeoLocation QPlace::location() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the location of the place.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name of the place.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::placeId() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the identifier of the place. The place identifier is only meaningful to the QPlaceManager that generated it and is not transferable between managers. The place identifier is not guaranteed to be universally unique, but unique for the manager that generated it.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::primaryEmail() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the primary email address for this place. This convenience function accesses the first contact detail of the email type. If no email addresses exist, then an empty string is returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::primaryFax() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the primary fax number for this place. This convenience function accesses the first contact detail of the fax type. If no fax details exist, then an empty string is returned.

db:section.db:title: QString QPlace::primaryPhone() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the primary phone number for this place. This accesses the first contact detail of the phone number type. If no phone details exist, then an empty string is returned.

db:section.db:title: QUrl QPlace::primaryWebsite() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the primary website of the place. This convenience function accesses the first contact detail of the website type. If no websites exist, then an empty string is returned.

db:section.db:title: QPlaceRatings QPlace::ratings() const
db:section.db:para: Returns an aggregated rating of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::removeContactDetails(const QString &contactType)
db:section.db:para: Removes all the contact details of a given contactType.
The contactType is no longer returned when QPlace::contactTypes() is called.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::removeExtendedAttribute(const QString &attributeType)
db:section.db:para: Remove the attribute of attributeType from the place.
The attribute will no longer be listed by QPlace::extendedAttributeTypes()

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setAttribution(const QString &attribution)
db:section.db:para: Sets the attribution string of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setCategories(const QList<QPlaceCategory> &categories)
db:section.db:para: Sets the categories that this place belongs to.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setCategory(const QPlaceCategory &category)
db:section.db:para: Sets a single category that this place belongs to.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setContactDetails(const QString &contactType, QList<QPlaceContactDetail> details)
db:section.db:para: Sets the contact details of a specified contactType.
If details is empty, then the contactType is removed from the place such that it is no longer returned by QPlace::contactTypes().
See QPlaceContactDetail for a list of common contact types.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setContent(QPlaceContent::Type type, const QPlaceContent::Collection &content)
db:section.db:para: Sets a collection of content for the given type.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setDetailsFetched(bool fetched)
db:section.db:para: Sets whether the details of this place have been fetched or not.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setExtendedAttribute(const QString &attributeType, const QPlaceAttribute &attribute)
db:section.db:para: Assigns an attribute of the given attributeType to a place. If the given attributeType already exists in the place, then it is overwritten.
If attribute is a default constructed QPlaceAttribute, then the attributeType is removed from the place which means it will not be listed by QPlace::extendedAttributeTypes().

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setIcon(const QPlaceIcon &icon)
db:section.db:para: Sets the icon of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setLocation(const QGeoLocation &location)
db:section.db:para: Sets the location of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setName(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Sets the name of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setPlaceId(const QString &identifier)
db:section.db:para: Sets the identifier of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setRatings(const QPlaceRatings &rating)
db:section.db:para: Sets the aggregated rating of the place.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setSupplier(const QPlaceSupplier &supplier)
db:section.db:para: Sets the supplier of this place to supplier.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setTotalContentCount(QPlaceContent::Type type, int totalCount)
db:section.db:para: Sets the totalCount of content objects of the given type.

db:section.db:title: void QPlace::setVisibility(QLocation::Visibility visibility)
db:section.db:para: Sets the visibility of the place to visibility.

db:section.db:title: QPlaceSupplier QPlace::supplier() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the supplier of this place.

db:section.db:title: int QPlace::totalContentCount(QPlaceContent::Type type) const
db:section.db:para: Returns the total count of content objects of the given type. This total count indicates how many the manager/provider should have available. (As opposed to how many objects this place instance is currently assigned).
A negative count indicates that the total number of items is unknown. By default the total content count is set to 0.

db:section.db:title: QLocation::Visibility QPlace::visibility() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the visibility of the place.

The default visibility of a new place is set to QtLocatin::Unspecified visibility. If a place is saved with unspecified visibility the backend chooses an appropriate default visibility to use when saving.

db:section.db:title: bool QPlace::operator!=(const QPlace &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other is not equal to this place, otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QPlace &QPlace::operator=(const QPlace &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other to this place and returns a reference to this place.

db:section.db:title: bool QPlace::operator==(const QPlace &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if other is equal to this place, otherwise returns false.
